title: Introducing a Fashion Editor's Guide to Dressing for 75-Degree Days in Los Angeles
excerpt: A fashion editor shares outfits to wear on 75-degree days in Los Angeles.
text: There's a science to dressing for 75-degree days, especially in Los Angeles. I hate to break it to you, but your casual shorts and T-shirt outfit formula just won't cut it. There's a massive outfit spectrum to consider for 75°. Even though it's warm, a slight breeze or cloud coverage can make you chilly, so you'll want a long-sleeve or light layer. But if the forecast calls for a clear, sunny day, that's ideal maxi skirt or dress weather. To help you (and honestly, myself) prepare for the late-spring forecast, I've compiled the perfect outfit mood board to master these days. Ahead, you'll find six outfits to get you through the season in style. From baggy jeans with mesh flats to Bermuda shorts with low heels, there's an outfit for every style. Scroll on to shop my favorite looks.Bermuda Shorts, Heels, and a Long-SleeveIf there's one person to look to for L.A. outfit inspiration, it's fashion consultant and former Revolve buyer Sara Walker. This look is one of my favorites. The long-sleeved butter-yellow top looks so comfy, and the long linen shorts are perfect for temperamental weather. Posse Exclusive Riviera Cooper Knit Cardigan Reformation William Linen Short JIL SANDER Leather Slingback Sandals T-Shirt, Barrel Jeans, and Mesh FlatsWhen I want to look polished in a pinch, a T-shirt and jeans never fail. The barrel jean silhouette is a fun way to spice up this combo, as is swapping regular ballet flats for a fun mesh pair. Baggy jeans and mesh flats will feel comfy whether or not the sun is out. SKIMS Stretch Cotton Jersey T-Shirt CITIZENS OF HUMANITY Miro Mid-Rise Barrel-Leg Recycled Jeans Tony Bianco Mia Mary Jane Flat Sporty Shorts, Button-Up, and LoafersIf you're bored of denim shorts, opt for sporty shorts instead. The light material is so comfortable for all-day wear. Dress the shorts up with a button-up top and loafers. Trust me—it just works. J.Crew Étienne Oversized Shirt in Lightweight Oxford Adidas Squandra 25 Aeroready Short Tank Top, Maxi Skirt, and Heeled SandalsHeading out on an early dinner date? A maxi skirt will keep you warm even when the sun goes down. Pair it with a basic tank, strappy sandals, and on-trend accessories for personal flair. Good American Fitted Rib Scoop Neck Tank Free People Lowen Midi Skirt Marc Fisher Ltd Ballen Ankle Strap Sandal Ettika Smooth Cuff Bracelet Maxi Dress, Sweater, and FlatsOn those perfect 75-degree days when there isn't a cloud in the sky, it's time to pull out the maxi dress. Wrap a sweater around your waist or shoulders in case a restaurant or store has the AC blasting—a just-in-case layer will never steer you wrong and acts as a chic styling piece. J.Crew Heritage Cotton Rollneck Sweater in Stripe Dôen Marianne Smocked Midi-Dress Reformation Small Silvana Bucket Bag Jeffrey Campbell Swan-Lake Flat All-White and Pointed-Toe HeelsWarm weather calls for an all-white look. White denim is heating up as summer gets closer, and having a pair in your wardrobe is essential. White denim will keep you cool on a sunny day, and I love how it looks when paired with a white top and black accessories. Still Here New York Everyday in Milk TOTEME The Sharp Croc-Effect Leather Slingback Pumps COACH Brooklyn 28 Shoulder Bag
html:
There's a science to dressing for 75-degree days, especially in Los Angeles. I hate to break it to you, but your casual shorts and T-shirt outfit formula just won't cut it. There's a massive outfit spectrum to consider for 75°. Even though it's warm, a slight breeze or cloud coverage can make you chilly, so you'll want a long-sleeve or light layer. But if the forecast calls for a clear, sunny day, that's ideal maxi skirt or dress weather. To help you (and honestly, myself) prepare for the late-spring forecast, I've compiled the perfect outfit mood board to master these days. Ahead, you'll find six outfits to get you through the season in style. From baggy jeans with mesh flats to Bermuda shorts with low heels, there's an outfit for every style. Scroll on to shop my favorite looks.

Bermuda Shorts, Heels, and a Long-Sleeve

If there's one person to look to for L.A. outfit inspiration, it's fashion consultant and former Revolve buyer Sara Walker. This look is one of my favorites. The long-sleeved butter-yellow top looks so comfy, and the long linen shorts are perfect for temperamental weather.

Posse

Exclusive Riviera Cooper Knit Cardigan

Reformation

William Linen Short

JIL SANDER

Leather Slingback Sandals

T-Shirt, Barrel Jeans, and Mesh Flats

When I want to look polished in a pinch, a T-shirt and jeans never fail. The barrel jean silhouette is a fun way to spice up this combo, as is swapping regular ballet flats for a fun mesh pair. Baggy jeans and mesh flats will feel comfy whether or not the sun is out.

SKIMS

Stretch Cotton Jersey T-Shirt

CITIZENS OF HUMANITY

Miro Mid-Rise Barrel-Leg Recycled Jeans

Tony Bianco

Mia Mary Jane Flat

Sporty Shorts, Button-Up, and Loafers

If you're bored of denim shorts, opt for sporty shorts instead. The light material is so comfortable for all-day wear. Dress the shorts up with a button-up top and loafers. Trust me—it just works.

J.Crew

Étienne Oversized Shirt in Lightweight Oxford

Adidas

Squandra 25 Aeroready Short

Tank Top, Maxi Skirt, and Heeled Sandals

Heading out on an early dinner date? A maxi skirt will keep you warm even when the sun goes down. Pair it with a basic tank, strappy sandals, and on-trend accessories for personal flair.

Good American

Fitted Rib Scoop Neck Tank

Free People

Lowen Midi Skirt

Marc Fisher Ltd

Ballen Ankle Strap Sandal

Ettika

Smooth Cuff Bracelet

Maxi Dress, Sweater, and Flats

On those perfect 75-degree days when there isn't a cloud in the sky, it's time to pull out the maxi dress. Wrap a sweater around your waist or shoulders in case a restaurant or store has the AC blasting—a just-in-case layer will never steer you wrong and acts as a chic styling piece.

J.Crew

Heritage Cotton Rollneck Sweater in Stripe

Dôen

Marianne Smocked Midi-Dress

Reformation

Small Silvana Bucket Bag

Jeffrey Campbell

Swan-Lake Flat

All-White and Pointed-Toe Heels

Warm weather calls for an all-white look. White denim is heating up as summer gets closer, and having a pair in your wardrobe is essential. White denim will keep you cool on a sunny day, and I love how it looks when paired with a white top and black accessories.
